author: Bronwyn Isaac
title: Sephora is launching a makeup class for people affected by cancer, and it is SO inspiring
text:
Sephora is launching a makeup class for people affected by cancer, and it is SO inspiring The newest of Sephora’s Classes for Confidence series has been officially announced, and it is targeted at people dealing with the physical toll of cancer. According to a People.com report, the retailer is launching a Brave Beauty in the Face of Cancer class later this week in over 40 cities across the U.S.
The 90-minute Sephora Brave Beauty in the Face of Cancer classes will focus on arming women (and men — all genders are invited) affected by cancer with techniques that will flatter and take care of their skin and hair. Plus, students can learn great makeup techniques that will help them down the road as they recover.
Being a model for first Brave Beauty class at Sephora World trade was truly an honor and something I will never forget ❤ thank you to everyone involved #awesomeness #sephora #sephoraworldtradecenter #sephorastands #cancersucks #inspirational #bravebeautyclasses #thankyou #love #beautytogether #sephorakop 
A post shared by @tuitej on Mar 18, 2017 at 9:39am PDT 
One of the Sephora facilitators, Michelle, told People.com that as a survivor, this is exactly the type of work she believes in, “When I had it, I shut down and never spoke about the fact that I had cancer. So I think this program was an eye opener that I can be an inspiration for others. I am so glad I am a part of it.” 
REMINDER: On March 26th, Sephora is hosting Brave Beauty in the Face of Cancer, a free 90 minute specialized beauty class for people affected by cancer. Bring your friends, family and loved ones to Sephora Riverside to join in on the fun. Please visit sephora.com to sign up. @sephorariverside #bravebeauty 
A post shared by . K A T H I E . (@katt.x) on Mar 22, 2017 at 8:45am PDT 
Each class will involve a comprehensive set of tips, including demonstrations on how students can use waterproof eyeliner to fill in lash lines, to using the shade matching tool Color IQ for the best foundation. The hope is, that students will feel free to talk openly about the intersections of their experiences with cancer, and their evolving beauty journey. Sephora is just there to provide people with more tools for their personal expression. 
Thank you @sephora for the #BraveBeauty class in NYC this morning! Women affected by all types of cancer learned skincare and makeup techniques from Sephora's coaches. 
A post shared by Young Survival Coalition (@youngsurvivalcoalition) on Mar 17, 2017 at 10:02am PDT
